title: Increasing the Minimum Wage for Federal Contractors

enrichment.summary: This executive order raises the minimum hourly wage for workers employed by federal contractors to at least $15 starting in early 2022, gradually increasing it over time. It also sets specific rules for tipped workers and requires federal agencies to include these wage standards in applicable contracts to improve worker pay and productivity.
potential_concerns: Increasing the minimum wage for federal contractors may lead to higher contract costs for the government.
Some small contractors might struggle to comply with the new wage requirements and could lose federal contracts.
The phased implementation for tipped workers may cause confusion in enforcement and wage calculation.
Annual adjustments tied to the Consumer Price Index could introduce unpredictability for contractors budgeting long-term projects.
Overlap or conflict with existing state or local minimum wage laws could complicate compliance efforts.
